intro: Rhodamnia longisepala, commonly known as the long-sepal rhodamnia, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its showy, fragrant flowers that typically bloom in spring. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves and can grow as a shrub or small tree. Its flowers are usually pink or white, with prominent sepals that are longer than the petals, giving it its scientific name. Rhodamnia longisepala is often found in heathlands and open forests, thriving in well-drained soils.
